resource.chars:
Pl. III. <u>Pyrosoma <\u> -
Fig.1. A single “zooid” viewed from the right side 
Fig.2. Do. from above 
“3. Part of the branchial network 
“4. The ovum with its pedicle in situ 
“5. Testis and ovisac in situ - both emptied 
of their contents 
“6. Ovum and pedicle 
“7. A young zooid developed by gemmation 
“8. Do. separated and enlarged - viewed 
from the ventral side 
“9. Youngest form of gemma observed 
“10. “Ciliated fossa” - with the ganglion and 
otolithes 
a. anterior extremity s. anal orifice 
b. posterior extremity v. lobe of the stomach 
c. endostyle u. tubular system 
d. ganglion & otolithes w. “ciliated sac” -
e. gill band (hypopharyngeal)
f. languet x. “ciliated band”
g. heart 
h. gemmiferous tube (single gemma in Pyrosoma)
i. nucleus ae. eleoblast 
k. muscular bands 
l. solitary foetus or young Salpa A.
m. placenta 
n. sinus running specially to the placenta 
o. Dorsal sinus 
p. testis [alpha] external tunic 
q. ovary or rather ovum  [beta] internal tunic 
q’. pedicle [gamma] partition of gemmiferous tube 
r. buccal orifice [delta] cell masses in Pyrosoma
